Very spacious and beautiful garden. Especially in this days where the weather is really nice it‚Äôs soon gonna be spring break. It‚Äôs only outside the Chatelet Les Halles train station that integrated with the Forum Les Halles mall, so it‚Äôs really convenient to walking by. So many great restaurants, cafes and stores around. Near marche Montorguile also so you‚Äôll be having fun there.
Good park for younger kids under 7yrs, however the jungle section with large slides and the big green spaceship things in the trees is closed off. Very close to the train station

A lovely place to stroll through on a spring or summers day. It‚Äôs colourful, lively and has a great vibe to it. Pop up rue Montorgueil for food or head straight though to the river or do a spot of shopping. The metro stop is Les Halles

The kids had great time climbing up and down in the younger children's playground. Unfortunately the older children's adventure playground was closed. We visited on one of the hottest days so far in this summer, the water mist feature was a big hit for the kids and grown-ups alike.
A very nice play area. Kids had a lot if fun. It is suitable from 3 years old till 12. It is for free
Amazing park in the centre of Paris with nice gardens and playground!! Big square with pedestrians area and a beautiful castle!! Lots of cherry blossoms trees!! üá®üáµüëç ‚Ä¶

It's an oasis in the middle of the city. Right next to a huge mall, so  the area gets really crowded there. The entry is limited to kids only and there are people at the gate letting the kids in. Looks really nice from the outside.
I was enchanted by this place. Really nice park. Modern shopping centre in contrast with historical buldings. Clean place full of energy. Oasis of relax.
Quiet enough, close by there is a shopping centre with a really cool cinema. Best to keep walking and don‚Äôt talk to strangers üò¨ ‚Ä¶
It's a nice playground for small kids at the city center, you can take a picture with colourful balloons and the cathedral as the background.
Fantastic and amazing location. Beautiful and wonderful garden.
Good place to rest , picnic and walk around !
Pretty, in the shadow of wonderfully elegant church building.  Great for a stroll in the City
Great park with lots of fun to be had. The water spray fountain is incredible for kids.
It is very nice play ground, but only the part for small children is open. The part for older children is closed (see photo for instruction).

The photos for this garden look lovely. But in reality it is a sad, smelly, run down park. The more impressive climbing frames are only for kids 7-12 (age enforced by park wardens), with a separate space for 2-6 year olds (with many kids over this age, ironically). The 2-6 park is run down, poorly maintained equipment, filthy and squalid toilet (poo smeared against the stalls in two stalls, sewage overflowing in the other). Park wardens smoking and not cleaning. The wider area is quite scary with the smells of urine and weed, lots of beggars and crowds.  Definitely not worth the trip. The owners of the playground need to upgrade the equipment, maintain the toilet facilities and give the area a deep clean.
Great Garden!! Impressive views.
The location is perfect, but it looks like a little bit dirty because of the smell of urine. And if you have toddlers, it is not allowed to use the playground. It's a place only for older kids.
If you are tired of shopping and walking , you can relax here. Have a seat and watch
Very stress relieving and calming area.

Nice reasonable sized park with seats and toilets.  Toilets are busy and not hugely clean. Children's playground. Next to the Les Halles complex and the train and metro station. Good place to relax for a short while during sightseeing or shopping.
Very pretty place but pretty scary at night. Also somewhat dirty, very stinky and there's usually quite a lot of people. In proximity with some of the cutest streets of Paris.
Really great playground structures. They're challenging for 5 year olds and adults alike. They even have guardians that keep an eye on your kids for you during the week, though we haven't tried it.
Not sure if it's a normal thing in France but the playground for 7 and up year olds is no parents allowed which scared our son and as a result he didn't get to play.
Hughe space with an underground mall
Really love this spot, used to sit here reading and having a snack
Beautiful park. Only complaint is that it's hours are limited but my kiddos thoroughly enjoyed every month. Impeccably kept up and wonderful for my 9 & 11 year old. Tres bien!

This is the space which used to be the market square of old Paris, hence the name 'les halles' which refers to the market halls. From here fresh produce was brought to the neighboring streets, which gave life to the restaurants, cafes and shops at the famous cobblestone-covered Rue Montorgueil nearby. The area was in a state of disrepair until recently, when it was renovated - now there is a multi-storey shopping mall here with all the usual stores inside, and outside a nice, airy park with some modern features. There are playgrounds that are popular with local kids. The church of St Eustace is worth checking out, which has been a notable feature of the site for centuries. In the evenings however you can see a lot of rats running around - a reminder of a Parisian problem, that has never really gone away.
One of the few places in Paris for kids. Crowded but useful
Warning: don‚Äôt jump fence. Dum warden. Only open once a hour to let kids in!!!!! Very strict
Always a pleasure to walk through the, garden in front of Les Halles. It was lively but peaceful.
Not the best park in Paris, there is little green. Fun for kids, with a playground and water fountains that spray rather than spout water so the kids don't get soaked.
Fantastic!  Super original and fun playground for kids. And lovely place to stroll around and for having picknicks in the garden.
Children's adventure park never open. Closed for rain constantly and yet its not raining Lazy park workers just come out of their office to change the sign and smoke their cigarettes in the park.
All new and redesigned garden of Chatelet. Perfect to hang out or picnic in summer. Great restaurants and coffee places all around.
I like to take a coffee and a roulete and to take a pause watching people there. Just a moment for your one. Nice place
